summary: A letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Christian R. Everdell to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, complaining about problems with the discovery production in Maxwell's criminal case, including late delivery and inaccessible files.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who authored the letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office complaining about discovery production issues.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell) who is incarcerated at the MDC and is having difficulty accessing discovery materials.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the scheduling order setting the deadline for initial non-electronic discovery production.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Copied on the letter as part of Maxwell's defense team at Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the letter as part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the letter as part of Maxwell's defense team.

connections.description: Everdell is writing as Maxwell's attorney to address discovery issues affecting her case.
Cohen is part of Maxwell's defense team, as indicated by being copied on the legal correspondence.
Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's defense team, as indicated by being copied on the legal correspondence.
Menninger is part of Maxwell's defense team, as indicated by being copied on the legal correspondence.
Both are attorneys at the same law firm (Cohen & Gresser LLP) working on Maxwell's defense.

events.title: Discovery Production Deadline
events.description: Court-ordered deadline for the government to complete production of initial non-electronic discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.

events.title: Late Discovery Delivery
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell finally received the third and final production of initial non-electronic discovery, several days after the court-imposed deadline.

events.title: Remaining Discovery Deadline
events.description: Scheduled deadline for the government to produce the remainder of the discovery in the case.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, Brooklyn, NY - implied location where Maxwell is held)
800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP address)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a formal complaint about discovery violations, citing late delivery and inaccessible files.
Maxwell received the final batch of initial non-electronic discovery on August 25, 2020, missing the court-ordered August 21 deadline.
Maxwell could not open numerous documents, audio, or video files from the discovery provided to her at the MDC.
The defense requested immediate reproduction of all initial discovery (Bates numbers SDNY GM 00000001 - SDNY GM 00174966) on a new hard drive with appropriate software.
The case is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), with Judge Nathan presiding.
